str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be displeased or offended with. From pros and a form of ochtheo; to feel indignant at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
From an obsolete primary noun; 'ever, 'by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
